meanings.definition: Each of two or more values of a variable that divide a frequency distribution into equal groups.
meanings.sent1: In statistics, a quantile helps us divide data into equal parts for analysis.
meanings.sent2: The 25th quantile is also known as the first quartile.
meanings.sent3: I asked the math teacher if a quantile is like a slice of cake for numbers.
meanings.sent4: The quantile acts as a gatekeeper, separating data into distinct sections.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing a quantile as a ruler that measures data chunks can be helpful.

meanings.definition: A point or value that marks the boundary of a quantile.
meanings.sent1: The quantile at 75% indicates the upper boundary of a data segment.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use the quantile to pinpoint specific data points in their analysis.
meanings.sent3: I imagined the quantile as a flag marking the end of a data range.
meanings.sent4: The quantile acts like a beacon, guiding us to crucial data thresholds.
meanings.sent5: Think of the quantile as a signpost showing where one data set ends and another begins.
